hints.label: def-fractal-set-simplicial-complex
hints.title: Fractal Set as Simplicial Complex
hints.content:
240: :label: def-fractal-set-simplicial-complex
241: 
242: **Source:** [13_E_cst_ig_lattice_qft.md § 3.2, lines 447-478]
243: 
244: The Fractal Set $\mathcal{F} = (\mathcal{E}, E_{\text{CST}} \cup E_{\text{IG}})$ is a **2-dimensional simplicial complex**:
245: 
246: **0-cells (vertices):** Episodes $e \in \mathcal{E}$
247: 
248: **1-cells (edges):**
249: - **Timelike edges:** CST edges $e_i \to e_j$ (directed)
250: - **Spacelike edges:** IG edges $e_i \sim e_j$ (undirected)
251: 
252: **2-cells (faces):** Plaquettes $P$ (alternating CST-IG 4-cycles):
253: 
254: $$
255: P = (e_0 \xrightarrow{\text{CST}} e_1 \xrightarrow{\text{IG}} e_2 \xrightarrow{\text{CST}} e_3 \xrightarrow{\text{IG}} e_0)
256: 
257: $$
258: 
259: **Boundary operator:** For a 2-cell $P = (e_0, e_1, e_2, e_3)$:
260: 
261: $$
262: \partial P = (e_0 \to e_1) + (e_1 \sim e_2) + (e_2 \to e_3) + (e_3 \sim e_0)
263: 
264: $$
265: 
266: **Cohomology:** The cohomology groups $H^k(\mathcal{F})$ classify topological features:
267: - $H^0$: Connected components

237: ### 3.1. Fractal Set as 2-Complex
238: 
239: :::{prf:definition} Fractal Set as Simplicial Complex
240: :label: def-fractal-set-simplicial-complex
241: 
242: **Source:** [13_E_cst_ig_lattice_qft.md § 3.2, lines 447-478]
243: 
244: The Fractal Set $\mathcal{F} = (\mathcal{E}, E_{\text{CST}} \cup E_{\text{IG}})$ is a **2-dimensional simplicial complex**:
245: 
246: **0-cells (vertices):** Episodes $e \in \mathcal{E}$
247: 
248: **1-cells (edges):**
249: - **Timelike edges:** CST edges $e_i \to e_j$ (directed)
250: - **Spacelike edges:** IG edges $e_i \sim e_j$ (undirected)
251: 
252: **2-cells (faces):** Plaquettes $P$ (alternating CST-IG 4-cycles):
253: 
254: $$
255: P = (e_0 \xrightarrow{\text{CST}} e_1 \xrightarrow{\text{IG}} e_2 \xrightarrow{\text{CST}} e_3 \xrightarrow{\text{IG}} e_0)
256: 
257: $$
258: 
259: **Boundary operator:** For a 2-cell $P = (e_0, e_1, e_2, e_3)$:
260: 
261: $$
262: \partial P = (e_0 \to e_1) + (e_1 \sim e_2) + (e_2 \to e_3) + (e_3 \sim e_0)
263: 
264: $$
265: 
266: **Cohomology:** The cohomology groups $H^k(\mathcal{F})$ classify topological features:
267: - $H^0$: Connected components
268: - $H^1$: Loops (1-cycles not bounding 2-chains)

hints.label: def-paths-wilson-loops
hints.title: Paths and Wilson Loops
hints.content:
273: :label: def-paths-wilson-loops
274: 
275: **Source:** [13_E_cst_ig_lattice_qft.md § 3.3, lines 482-520]
276: 
277: A **path** in $\mathcal{F}$ is a sequence:
278: 
279: $$
280: \gamma = (e_0, e_1, \ldots, e_n)
281: 
282: $$
283: 
284: where consecutive episodes are connected by either CST edge (timelike step) or IG edge (spacelike step).
285: 
286: **Path classification:**
287: 1. **Timelike path:** All edges are CST edges (follows genealogy)
288: 2. **Spacelike path:** All edges are IG edges (stays within one time slice)
289: 3. **Mixed path:** Contains both CST and IG edges
290: 
291: **Closed loop:** A path with $e_n = e_0$ (returns to starting episode).
